baseline: It included symptoms common to depressive adults and adolescents as well as symptoms peculiar to adolescents, which was confirmed by comparison with adult depression scales.
positive_variation: It included symptoms common to depressive adults and adolescents as well as symptoms peculiar to adolescents, which was confirmed by comparison with adult depression experiences.
negative_variation: It included symptoms common to depressive adults and adolescents as well as symptoms unique to adolescents, which was confirmed by comparison with adult depression complications.

baseline: Of particular interest was the finding that the primary diagnosis for 85 of the F,Sc MMPI type was no mental_disorder in spite of the fact that this group showed significantly more disturbed behavior on the ward (anxiety, depression, suspicion, and manic excitement) and had uniquely degraded their victims.
positive_variation: Of particular interest was the finding that the primary diagnosis for 85 of the F,Sc MMPI type was no mental disorder in spite of the fact that this group displayed notably more complex behavior on the ward (anxiety, depression, suspicion, and manic excitement) and had distinctively challenged their victims.
negative_variation: Of particular interest was the finding that the primary diagnosis for 85 of the F,Sc MMPI type was no mental disorder in spite of the fact that this group exhibited markedly more troubling behavior on the ward (anxiety, depression, suspicion, and manic excitement) and had significantly harmed their victims.

baseline: Loss and abandonment and distortions of the self-image have special significance for the causation and treatment of depression during adolescence.
positive_variation: Loss and abandonment and distortions of the self-image have special significance for understanding and addressing depression during adolescence.
negative_variation: Loss and abandonment and distortions of the self-image have critical implications for the intensification and management of depression during adolescence.

baseline: No support was found for the prediction derived from Beck's cognitive theory, which posits distorted, negative cognitions about the self as the central dynamic of depression.
positive_variation: No support was found for the prediction derived from Beck's cognitive theory, which posits constructive, self-reflective cognitions about the self as the central dynamic of depression.
negative_variation: No support was found for the prediction derived from Beck's cognitive theory, which posits damaging, negative cognitions about the self as the central dynamic of depression.

baseline: Evidence obtained from the earlier investigations to the effect that cerebral age changes short of those occurring in dementia may facilitate the occurrence of depression in late life was only weakly confirmed by the replication study.
positive_variation: Evidence obtained from the earlier investigations suggested that cerebral age changes, even when not reaching those occurring in dementia, may contribute positively to the development of coping mechanisms for depression in late life, though this was only weakly confirmed by the replication study.
negative_variation: Evidence obtained from the earlier investigations to the effect that cerebral age changes short of those occurring in dementia could dangerously promote the onset of depression in late life was only weakly confirmed by the replication study.

baseline: Used a measure of reduction in experienced control to investigate two aspects of the learned helplessness model of depression.
positive_variation: Employed a measure of increased understanding to investigate two beneficial aspects of the learned helplessness model of depression.
negative_variation: Used a measure of a significant drop in perceived autonomy to investigate two detrimental aspects of the learned helplessness model of depression.

baseline: These differences are attributed to variations in the self-structure which mediates the subjective experience of depression in the different cultures.
positive_variation: These differences are attributed to variations in the self-structure which enriches the subjective experience of depression in the different cultures.
negative_variation: These differences are attributed to variations in the self-structure which exacerbates the subjective experience of depression in the different cultures.

baseline: One mood (selfreported Depression) and two LHQ factors (Social Participation and Antisocial Behavior) contributed uniquely to a multiple regression equation for prediction of effectiveness in recruit training.
positive_variation: One mood (self-reported Depression) and two LHQ factors (Social Participation and Antisocial Behavior) contributed positively to a multiple regression equation for prediction of effectiveness in recruit training.
negative_variation: One mood (self-reported Depression) and two LHQ factors (Social Participation and Antisocial Behavior) contributed detrimentally to a multiple regression equation for prediction of effectiveness in recruit training.

baseline: Forty-one unipolar depressed outpatients were randomly assigned to individual treatment with either cognitive therapy (N =19)or imipramine (N =22).As a group, the patients had been intermittently or chronically depressed with a mean period of 8.8 years since the onset of their first episode of depression, and 75were suicidal.
positive_variation: Forty-one unipolar depressed outpatients were randomly assigned to individual treatment with either cognitive therapy (N =19) or imipramine (N =22). As a group, the patients had been intermittently or chronically experiencing depression with a mean period of 8.8 years since the onset of their first episode of depression, and 75 were considered for supportive interventions.
negative_variation: Forty-one unipolar depressed outpatients were randomly assigned to individual treatment with either cognitive therapy (N =19) or imipramine (N =22). As a group, the patients had been intermittently or chronically suffering from depression with a mean period of 8.8 years since the onset of their first episode of depression, and 75 were increasingly at risk of suicidal actions.

baseline: Classical conditioning was successful in 11 animals, involving 6 cortical and 5 caudate spreading depression sites.
positive_variation: Classical conditioning was successful in 11 animals, involving 6 cortical and 5 caudate resilient depression sites.
negative_variation: Classical conditioning was successful in 11 animals, involving 6 cortical and 5 caudate harmful depression sites.
